item.title: Cyberpunk 2077: The Best Pieces Of Cyberware In Every Slot (& Where To Get Them)
item.description:
Cyberware has forever changed in Cyberpunk 2077 thanks to the release of Update 2.0 and onwards. To those who own the expansion, Phantom Liberty , Cyberpunk 2077 's best cyberware has evolved even more, providing plenty of opportunity for advancements in V's arsenal and chrome for both players of the base game and the expansion. With new changes hitting Cyberpunk 2077 , players on 2.0 and onwards will want to know the best cyberware in every slot.

If players want to become cyberpsychos, or just have enough chrome to rival that of Adam Smasher. In that case, they can find the potential to be the very best right here, with plenty of specified cyberware for every available slot, including their stats, where to get them, and how to further enhance the cybernetic arsenal of V.

All cyberware listed below was purchased at Tier 5 on a Level 60 account with 20 Attribute Points in Technical Ability.

Best Operating System Cyberware

Operating System cyberware includes cyberdecks that improve and expand your quickhacking abilities, as well as Berserk and Sandevistan systems that help you in combat.

Players can only equip one Operating System at a time, but each of them have different advantages. Whilst quickhacks serve their own usefulness, this guide will instead seek the use of one for base game players, and one for Phantom Liberty owners, both are used to complement combat.

Militech "Falcon" Sandevistan

Purchased From Any Ripperdoc For â‚¬$19,947

Cyberware Cost

Description

Attribute Attunement

39

  • Press E/LB+RB/L1+R1 to activate and deactivate. It can be activated at any charge level.

When active:

  • Slows time by 70% (you are not slowed)
  • 10% damage
  • 10% Crit Chance
  • 5% Crit Damage

Neutralizing an enemy when active gives:

  • +5% extended duration
  • +10% Health
  • Max Duration: 10 sec.
  • Cooldown: 35 sec.

Reflexes Attuned: +0.1 sec. duration per Attribute Point. (Maximum total: 2 sec.)

With a Sandevistan, players are on their way to becoming unstoppable, since this grants the ability to slow time so much, that it is effectively stopping it, whilst players are able to move at full speed themselves. This allows them to become the fastest merc alive, where they will easily be able to take out armies before they can even fire a shot.

Chrome Compressor

Purchased From Any Dogtown Ripperdoc For â‚¬$57,867

Cyberware Cost

Description

0

  • +61 Cyberware Capacity

For those who can access Dogtown through Phantom Liberty, they might want to grab the Chrome Compressor, instead of something like a Sandevistan. Whilst they cannot slow time or use quick hacks, the fact that they can equip even more cyberware means this will turn V into a more stable, but equally lethal, Adam Smasher.

Best Face Cyberware

Face cyberware improves your vision and allows you to highlight environmental clues.

Players can only have one Face Cyberware in the base game, and this will always be Optics. Whilst Phantom Liberty owners can have the Behavioral Imprint-Synced Faceplate, this is unmissable and story-related, making it not necessary when discussing the best cyberware.

Kiroshi "The Oracle" Optics

Purchased From Any Ripperdoc For â‚¬$16,961

Cyberware Cost

Description

Attribute Attunement

Modifiers

10

Effects active when scanning:

  • Highlights enemies within 17.5m., including enemies behind cover.
  • Highlights explosive devices and traps near your crosshair and within 26m.
  • These effects remain active for 60 sec. after scanning.
  • 10x optical zoom when scanning or aiming.

Body Attuned: +0.5 Health per Attribute Point. (Maximum total: +10)

  • +2.6% Health
  • 2.6% Bonus damage against enemies at full health

All Optic cyberware is pretty good, but The Oracle version of the Kiroshi implants are one of the best, purely because it will show players where enemies are located, even when they are hiding. It also shows cameras and turrets for stealth players, and traps, for those unaware of danger.

Best Hands Cyberware

Hand cyberware improves your ranged combat skills.

Players can have one slot in hand cyberware, but with the Ambidextrous perk in the Technical Ability tree, they can have a total of two. This list will include a total of three, with one being optional cyberware from Phantom Liberty.

Shock Absorber

Purchased From Any Ripperdoc For â‚¬$33,915

Cyberware Cost

Description

Attribute Attunement

Modifiers

12

  • -20% recoil

Cool Attuned: +0.2% headshot and weakspot damage per Attribute Point. (Maximum total: 2%)

  • +2.5% Health
  • +2.1% Melee Damage Resistance

Recoil can be quite the burden in Cyberpunk 2077 , so by using the Shock Absorber hand cyberware, players will be able to negate it rather easily and permit themselves to more accurate shooting for when things start to get a little too hectic in Night City.

Microgenerator

Purchased From Any Ripperdoc For â‚¬$33,915

Cyberware Cost

Description

Attribute Attunement

Modifiers

9

  • Reloading an empty weapon causes the next shot to release an electroshock that deals up to 200 Electrical damage to enemies near the point of impact.
  • Electroshock damage increases with the number of bullets reloaded (max. 5 bullets).

Intelligence Attuned: 0.05% to all dealt damage per Attribute Point. (Maximum total: 1%)

  • +3.1% Explosion Damage
  • +2.2% Reload Speed

Realizing a magazine is empty can be pretty deadly, but staying on top of it will reward players with a nice surprise, as they can load a powerful Electrical damage shot to the first bullet in a fresh mag, just try not to miss.

Immovable Force

Purchased From Any Dogtown Ripperdoc For â‚¬$67,824

Cyberware Cost

Description

Modifiers

35

  • -30% recoil
  • -25% bullet spread
  • Automatically activates effects for ranged weapons that otherwise only occur when behind cover

  • +1.6% Health Regen Bonus
  • 3.1% Health

Add even more recoil reduction to V's hand with this Phantom Liberty cyberware, which will also decrease the bullet spread of some weapons, meaning that players are going to hit more accurate shots with their guns without worrying about a stray bullet whizzing past their foes.

Best Circulatory System Cyberware

Circulatory System cyberware affects Stamina and Health regeneration.

Stamina and Health are two absolutely vital stats for players in Cyberpunk 2077 , and they can have 3 Circulatory System slots to further complement these stats.

Second Heart

Purchased From Any Ripperdoc For â‚¬$19,947

Cyberware Cost

Description

Attribute Attunement

Modifiers

30

  • +100% Health when your Health reaches 0. (May not activate in some situations, such as falling from extreme heights.)
  • Cooldown: 240 sec.

Body Attuned: +0.5 Health per Attribute Point (Maximum total: +10)

  • +2.6% Explosion Damage
  • 2.6% Grenade Recharge Speed

If players are heading into war, then Second Heart is essential, as it will restore players' full health, regardless of their healing items, when it reaches zero. This basically means players have an extra life when in the middle of a fight.

Blood Pump

Purchased From Any Ripperdoc For â‚¬$7,980

Cyberware Cost

Description

Attribute Attunement

Modifiers

15

  • Functions as a powerful Health Item.
  • Instantly restores 85 Hleaht, then regenerates 17 Health per second for 6 sec.

Technical Ability Attuned: +0.1% Health Item efficiency per Attribute Point. (Maximum total: +2%)

  • +2.1% Quickhack Damage
  • +2.6% Damage Over Time

Health Items are a necessity in Cyberpunk 2077 2.0, as no longer will players have infinite consumables to spam. They have Health Items on a time limit after use, so with the Blood Pump, they can restore so much health, and kickstart health regeneration to the point where they won't need any other form of healing.

Clutch Padding

Purchased From Any Ripperdoc For â‚¬$33,915

Cyberware Cost

Description

Attribute Attunement

Modifiers

12

  • -18% Stamina cost for shooting

Body Attuned: +0.5 Health per Attribute Point. (Maximum total: +10)

  • +1.8% Reload Speed
  • 5.2% Aim Speed

Players now exhaust stamina when shooting weapons, so with Clutch Padding, players can now ease off the stamina use, and conserve some energy, since they will spend less stamina when shooting from now on.

Best Legs Cyberware

Leg Cyberware improves your mobility and slightly increases Armor.

Jump to great heights or experienced advanced mobility unseen by any other merc in Night City with the best leg cyberware, which players can only have one at a time.

Reinforced Tendons

Purchased From Any Ripperdoc For â‚¬$15,958

Cyberware Cost

Armor Points

Description

Attribute Attunement

Modifiers

8

10

  • Press Space/A/X in midair to perform a double jump.

Reflexes Attuned: 0.1% Crit Chance per Attribute Point. (Maximum total: 2%)

  • +1.3% Health Regen bonus
  • +0.6% Explosion Damage Resistance

Whilst many of the leg cyberware options are great, Reinforced Tendons opens up new possibilities of movements thanks to the double jump, allowing players to hop into the air for evasive mobility, and even reach new heights during parkour.

Best Integumentary System Cyberware

Integumentary System cyberware improves armor and damage resistance.

Armor is imperative to players who enjoy getting in the fight without stealth, and instead resort to fully-fledged action mayhem. With 3 Integumentary System slots, players can buff their damage resistance and their armor to become killing machines, but this section will include 4, with the addition of 1 Phantom Liberty Integumentary System.

Pain Editor

Purchased From Any Ripperdoc For â‚¬$118,687

Cyberware Cost

Armor Points

Description

Attribute Attunement

Modifiers

28

108

  • -7% all incoming damage

Cool Attuned: +0.1% damage reduction per Attribute Point. (Maximum total: 2%)

  • +0.6% Mitigation Chance
  • +2.3% Damage Over Time Resistance

Extremely expensive, but extremely rewarding, the Pain Editor will not only grant an extreme bonus to the total armor of V's person, but it will also grant a 7% reduction to incoming damage. This is quite a large amount when players consider how deadly all attacks can be, and now, a permanent reduction is added.

Painducer

Purchased From Any Ripperdoc For â‚¬$84,778

Cyberware Cost

Armor Points

Description

Attribute Attunement

Modifiers

24

138

  • Converts 30% of damage taken into damage-over-time.

Body Attuned: +0.5% damage-over-time resistance per Attribute Point. (Maximum total: +10%)

  • +1.4% Health Item Effect
  • +2.9% Reduced damage from Poisoned enemies

Another whopping increase to V's total armor capacity, Painducer is also a worthy piece of cyberware due to the fact it converts 30% of damage into damage-over-time, allowing players to better navigate the combat situation as they heal out that damage instead of losing chunks of their health at once.

Cellular Adapter

Purchased From Any Ripperdoc For â‚¬$84,778 After Acquiring Built Different Perk

Cyberware Cost

Armor Points

Description

Modifiers

8

146

Technical Ability Attuned:

  • +1% explosion resistance (maximum total: 20%)
  • +0.5% Tech weapon damage (maximum total: 10%)
  • +0.5% Health Item recharge speed (maximum total: 10%)
  • +0.5% grenade recharge speed (maximum total: 10%)

  • +1.6% Health Regen Bonus
  • +15.6 Carrying Capacity
  • +3.1 Health

Players will need to head into their Technical Ability tree and unlock Built Different to access this cyberware, but it's something they should definitely do, due to the fact that with each Technical Ability point, they will increase their total resistance to certain items, as well as increase their recharge rates for grenades and healing items.

Chitin

Purchased From Any Dogtown Ripperdoc For â‚¬$33,915

Cyberware Cost

Armor Points

Description

Attribute Attunement

Modifiers

40

200

  • An extremely durable subcutaneous shell made of genetically modified chitin.
  • Provides additional Health Regen.

Body Attuned: +10% Health Regen Rate per Attribute Point. (Maximum total: 200%)

  • +1.6% Health Regen Bonus
  • +3.1% Health

Exclusive for Phantom Liberty owners, Chitin is a pretty great cyberware for the Integumentary System, due to its high stats and durability in the armor department. Not only will players see a great armor bonus, but the fact their health regen rate can practically double makes this a must-have.

Best Nervous System Cyberware

Nervous System cyberware affects time-slowing effects and detection by enemies.

Nervous System mods are perhaps the most skippable of the bunch, unless players are going for Netrunner builds. With these mods, players can find a few bonuses to their time-slowing effects, with 3 slots to fill.

Kerenzikov

Purchased From Any Dogtown Ripperdoc For â‚¬$7,980

Cyberware Cost

Description

Attribute Attunement

Modifiers

12

  • Allows you to aim and perform ranged attacks while sliding, dodging or Dashing.
  • Slows time by 60% for 3.5 sec. when you aim a ranged attack during ga slide, dodge or Dash.
  • Cooldown: 6.5 sec.

Reflexes Attuned: +0/1% Crit Chance per Attribute Point. (Maximum total: +0.7%)

  • +2% Reload Speed
  • +2.9% Weapon Handling

The Kerenzikov is an interesting addition to cyberware, as it effectively allows players more freedom of play, as they will be able to aim weapons and perform ranged attacks during intensely fast bursts of movement, and even slow time occasionally during these exciting bouts.

Neofiber

Purchased From Any Ripperdoc For â‚¬$11,969

Cyberware Cost

Description

Attribute Attunement

Modifiers

14

  • +10% Mitigation Chance
  • +9% Mitigation Strength

Mitigation grants a chance to reduce incoming damage by current Mitigation Strength (default: 50%)

Reflexes Attuned: +0.1% Crit Chance per Attribute Point. (Maximum total: +2%)

  • +1.4% Bonus Richoet Damage
  • +2.3% Melee Damage Resistance

With Neofiber equipped, players might be able to reduce incoming damage, depending on their total Mitigation Strength. This could easily see players tank powerful attacks, shrugging them off like BB pellets.

Adrenaline Converter

Purchased From Any Dogtown Ripperdoc For â‚¬$16,961

Cyberware Cost

Description

Attribute Attunement

Modifiers

6

  • 40% movement speed for 7 sec. when entering combat.

Cool Attuned: +0.2% headshot and weakspot damage per Attribute Point. (Maximum total: 4%)

  • +2.9% Explosion Damage
  • +2.9% Damage Over Time

When starting combat, the bonus of 40% movement speed is going to really help players move around and stay in the fight, gaining advance even when surprised, and that's all thanks to the Adrenaline Converter cyberware.

Best Skeleton Cyberware

Skeleton cyberware improves your Armor and overall defense.

Players can equip 2 cyberware in the Skeleton slots, but if they have 3 tiers in Technical Ability's License to Chrome, then they can have a total of 3 slots. Phantom Liberty players can also find a great and expensive piece of cyberware exclusively for them below.

Epimorphic Skeleton

Purchased From Any Ripperdoc For â‚¬$27,926

Cyberware Cost

Armor Points

Description

Attribute Attunement

Modifiers

40

126

+13% Max Health

Body Attuned: +0.5% Health per Attribute Point. (Maximum total: +10%)

  • +0.5% Mitigation Strength
  • +1.3% Health Item Effect

A bonus to armor points and an incredible bonus to Max Health, players are in for a treat with Epimorphic Skeleton. With the maximum amount of Body Attribute, there's a total increase of 26% in Health, which can truly save V's hide in the challenging combat encounters that await them.

Universal Booster

Purchased From Any Ripperdoc For â‚¬$84,778

Cyberware Cost

Armor Points

Description

Attribute Attunement

Modifiers

25

138

Health Items now also give:

  • +9% Armor for 5 sec.
  • -27% all Stamina costs for 5 sec.

These effects can stack.

Technical Ability Attuned: +0.5 Armor per Attribute Point. (Maximum total: +10)

  • +1.3% Health Item Effect
  • +1.6% Health Item Recharge Speed

More armor means less problems for V, and the Universal Booster also has the addition of providing additional armor and reduced stamina cost with the use of a Health Item, a stat that can stack with additional healing uses.

Scar Coalescer

Purchased From Any Ripperdoc For â‚¬$84,778

Cyberware Cost

Armor Points

Description

Attribute Attunement

Modifiers

16

34

  • +22% Armor when below 50% Health.

Body Attuned: +0.5% Health per Attribute Point. (Maximum total: +10%)

  • +4.7 Armor
  • +2.5% Damage Over Time Resistance

Mainly reserved for when things are getting tough, Scar Coalescer is a great backup plan, as it will see V receive an additional 22% armor when their health reaches below 50%. Whilst it hopefully won't be vital in difficult runs, it's always good to have a safety net.

Rara Avis

Purchased From Any Dogtown Ripperdoc For â‚¬$211,935

Cyberware Cost

Description

Attribute Attunement

Modifiers

36

  • +37% Armor

Body Attuned: +2 Health per Attribute Point. (Maximum total: +40)

  • +3.1 Health
  • +2.5% Melee Damage Resistance

An amazing buff to armor, players can experience a 37% increase in their total armor stats, showcasing the power of Rara Avis. The more armor players already have, the greater the buff, providing great potential within this skeleton cyberware.

Best Arms Cyberware

Arm cyberware includes powerful melee cyberware options as well as the Projectile Launch System.

Whilst there are a lot of fun options for arms cyberware, players can only equip one at a time, so they will have to choose what they prefer in terms of weaponry, but there is one option that is notably better than the rest.

Gorilla Arms

Purchased From Any Ripperdoc For â‚¬$86,266

Cyberware Cost

Weapon Stats

Description

Attribute Attunement

Modifiers

8

  • Attack Speed: 2.6
  • Damage Per Hit: 1.43
  • Stamina Cost: 9.6

  • Gorilla Arms are lightweight, efficient, and hard-hitting arm replacement cyberware.
  • +6 to Bodyt Attribute checks.
  • Deal Physical damage.
  • 20% Bleeding chance

Body Attuned: +0.5% damage with this cyberware per Attribute Point. (Maximum total: +10%)

  • +2.6 Health
  • +2.1% Melee Damage Resistance

Whilst Gorilla Arms doesn't have the cool factor that other arm cyberware does, it does make things a lot easier, since players will have a +6 to Body, even if they lack the Attribute Points in that department, thus allowing them to potentially force open doors and use more Body dialogue options. It also aids in melee-focused events, like Beat on the Brat missions.

Best Frontal Cortex Cyberware

Frontal Cortex cyberware improves the use of quickhacks and decreases cooldowns.

Players can have a maximum of three Frontal Cortex cyberware attachments for V to use, and listed below, players can find the potential best three revolving around gun combat.

Mechatronic Core

Purchased From Any Ripperdoc For â‚¬$16,961

Cyberware Cost

Description

Attribute Attunement

Modifiers

5

  • +35% damage against drones, robots, mechs and turrets
  • +2 Max RAM

Technical Ability Attuned: +0.5 Armor per Attribute Point. (Maximum total: +10)

  • +2.9% Explosion Damage
  • +2.9% Grenade Recharge Speed

Mechatronic Core is a great way to start the Frontal Cortex mods, as it's essentially a free slot in which players will deal 35% more damage against drones, robots, mechs and turrets. This is already great, and players will notice the damage improvements on their weapons as they fight against enemies that have too much tech in their arsenal.

Self-Ice

Purchased From Any Ripperdoc For â‚¬$16,961

Cyberware Cost

Description

Attribute Attunement

Modifiers

5

  • Automatically negates an enemy quickhack.
  • +2 Max RAM
  • Cooldown: 29 sec.

Intelligence Attuned: -0.5 sec. Cooldown with this cyberware per Attribute Point. (Maximum total: -10 sec.)

  • +2.3% Melee Damage Resistance
  • +2.3% Damage Over Time Resistance

Enemy Netrunners can cause quite a commotion, especially when they are in hiding. With Self-Ice, players will be able to prevent themselves from being hacked, once every 29 seconds. This gives players more time to hunt down the rogue Netrunner that is trying to cause their cyberware to overheat, among other disadvantages they would face against such an enemy.

Kerenzikov Boost System

Purchased From Any Ripperdoc For â‚¬$33,915

Cyberware Cost

Description

Attribute Attunement

Modifiers

3

  • Improves Kerenzikov by enhancing the user's speed and reflexes.

When Kerenzikov is active:

  • -100% Stamina cost from shooting.
  • Slows time by +15% relative to your enemies.

Reflexes Attuned: +0.1% Crit Chance per Attribute Point. (Maximum total: 2%)

  • 2.2% Reload Speed
  • 6.2% Aim Speed

For this setup of cyberware, the Kerenzikov is going to come in handy, so why not add to the flair by equipping the Kerenzikov Boost System, which will see further enhancements from using that cyberware, including a great bonus to stamina cost when shooting, and slowing time to an even longer degree.

item.title: Naruto's Next Fighting Game Should Diverge From Ultimate Ninja Storm Connections' Roster
item.description:
Highlights

  • Naruto X Boruto Ultimate Ninja Storm Connections celebrates the series with a massive roster and new story modes.
  • With over 130 characters, the game highlights the need for quality over quantity in future Naruto titles.
  • The next Naruto game should pivot from the Ultimate Ninja Storm series to keep the franchise fresh and engaging, focusing on deep gameplay for each member of the cast instead of a staggering character count.

The Naruto Ultimate Ninja Storm franchise has had a good run overall, providing fans with some of the most thorough fan service in all licensed Shonen Jump games. Even Naruto 's author Masashi Kishimoto has acknowledged CyberConnect2â€™s arena fighters as being one of the best ways to consume Naruto 's story, thanks to their dense story modes and gorgeous cinematics. Naruto X Boruto Ultimate Ninja Storm Connections is the latest of these, and is arguably a celebration of the UNS series itself rather than Naruto. If any licensed game series deserves that, it's this one, and Naruto X Boruto Ultimate Ninja Storm Connections demonstrates why that is.

Every playable character from across the Ultimate Ninja Storm series, except for certain special cases like the Tekken guest character Lars Alexandersson, is playable in Naruto X Boruto Ultimate Ninja Storm Connections . Highlight fights featuring them can be replayed in its condensed campaign, and there's even a new story mode featuring Boruto 's cast and some original characters. Throw in custom costumes and another pass on the battle mechanics, and it's plain to see why Ultimate Ninja Storm Connections could be considered the ultimate Naruto game. It's also why Naruto games may want to quit while they're ahead and scale back their next titleâ€™s roster.

Naruto Ultimate Ninja Storm Canâ€™t Keep Its Roster Stable For Much Longer

Over 130 characters, with more coming as DLC, is an impressive achievement, and represents the highest roster count in Naruto games so far. Fans can craft almost any battle scenario in Naruto that they can imagine, throwing out the signature Jutsu's in their best animated forms yet. However, all of those characters come at a price, and it's been showing through in the gameplay since the beginning. Ultimate Ninja Storm already started with simpler basic controls than the Naruto games before it, and it lost more mechanics and attacks over time, even as others rose to take their place.

The Next Naruto Game Canâ€™t Be Another Ninja Storm

With Naruto X Boruto Ultimate Ninja Storm Connections being the grand celebration it is, itâ€™s the ideal time to start over. Fans have wanted something new out of Naruto games for a while now, and even the long-running Naruto to Boruto: Shinobi Striker is getting too long in the tooth. Whether that means it's time to finally pivot back to a traditional fighting game, try a different arena fighter approach, or do something completely different, Ultimate Ninja Storm â€™s roster will need to be pared down.

Future Naruto Games Have Plenty Of Reasons To Shrink Their Rosters

Pivoting to a focus on quality character design over quantity may be risky, but it could be better received than the past decade of Naruto games, and that's not all. A smaller roster wouldn't just stand out from prior Naruto games, but from other major players in the anime game space as well. In particular, the upcoming Dragon Ball: Sparking Zero and its 164-character launch roster should be more than enough to satiate any shonen game fans who want that. Sparking Zero might push back other Dragon Ball games with its sheer scope, so having another licensed giant to contrast it could be good for both.

Fewer Characters Would Put Less Pressure On A Boruto Game

Then there's the matter of justifying this smaller roster. Despite having taken over the Naruto franchise for several years running, Boruto doesn't have a big-budget game adaptation. Even if the resulting title is focused purely on adapting material from before Boruto 's timeskip, there should be more than enough to match the campaign of the first Ultimate Ninja Storm , while also keeping the roster humble compared to the last UNS . Whatever the case may be, Naruto X Boruto Ultimate Ninja Storm Connections has pushed Naruto 's roster far enough, and the next Naruto game has everything to gain from changing directions.

item.title: Yu-Gi-Oh Master Duel Announces New Login Campaign with Free Gems
item.description:
Highlights

  • Yu-Gi-Oh Master Duel announces its new "Road to Worlds" login campaign, granting players a variety of rewards for logging in for seven days.
  • The login campaign will reward players with up to 1,000 Gems, a Royal Finish card, and an exclusive icon.
  • Master Duel's newest event precedes the upcoming World Championship Qualifier, with players competing for a spot at the game's World Championship.

Yu-Gi-Oh Master Duel has announced the game's newest login campaign, packed with plenty of free Gems, an exclusive icon, and a Royal Finish card. The massively popular digital trading card game features plenty of different ways for players to earn Gems between its different game modes. Players can earn more Gems by climbing through the game's Ranked mode, completing the various Master Duel Solo Mode stories, and through its litany of missions. Now, the newest login campaign for the game is celebrating the upcoming World Championship.

Yu-Gi-Oh Master Duel 's regular events offer multiple opportunities for the game's most competitive players to see how they stack up against one another. Master Duel regularly hosts "Duelist Cup" events, a two-stage competitive-focused event where players compete for a spot at the Yu-Gi-Oh Master Duel World Championship. Konami has also held a "World Championship Qualifier" event as a direct road to the game's Worlds, featuring regional ladders for players to earn their invites. With 2024's qualifiers on the horizon, Master Duel is ringing in the tournament season with free login rewards.

Yu-Gi-Oh Master Duel has officially announced its "Road to Worlds" campaign, featuring free login rewards and exclusive cards for players. Players logging into Yu-Gi-Oh Master Duel for seven days during the campaign will be able to earn up to 1,000 Gems to spend on in-game packs and cosmetics. The login campaign will also gift players a special Royal Finish version of "Number C62: Neo Galaxy-Eyes Prime Photon Dragon," as well as an exclusive icon based on the card. The Master Duel login event is scheduled to begin on June 7.

Yu-Gi-Oh Master Duel Announces "Road to Worlds" Login Campaign

The event will celebrate the beginning of Master Duel 's World Championship Qualifier event, currently expected to debut in mid-June. The event will play similarly to Master Duel 's "Duelist Cup" events, with players competing with one another to reach Duelist Level 20 and qualify for the event's second stage. The second stage of the event rewards the top player in each of its five regions with an invite to the Yu-Gi-Oh Master Duel World Championship. Last year's World Championship Qualifier came amidst one of Master Duel 's most notorious "Tier 0" metas, surrounding the "Tearlaments" archetype.

The debut of the newest competitive Master Duel event arrives as Konami has continued to make consistent updates to the online TCG. Each month features a new update to Yu-Gi-Oh Master Duel 's banlist, often addressing some of the game's most powerful cards and strategies. Konami has also continued to introduce new cards from the physical game, with monthly Selection Packs and Secret Packs making even more cards available to players. Yu-Gi-Oh Master Duel 's "Road to Worlds" will look to benefit all of the beloved card game's playerbase, from competitive to casual Duelists.

item.title: Monster Hunter Wilds Confirms Game-Changing New Feature
item.description:
Highlights

  • Meet the Seikret, a new mount in Monster Hunter Wilds that allows players to switch weapons quickly during hunts for added combat versatility.
  • Capcom showed new Monster Hunter Wilds gameplay at the latest State of Play event.
  • In addition to the Seikret's weapon sling feature, Monster Hunter Wilds will introduce pack behavior for large creatures and new diverse locations to explore.

Monster Hunter Wilds will introduce fans of the series to a new mount that will give them a way to switch their weapons much more quickly than in previous installments. The new mount, called a Seikret, will possess a variety of useful skills to aid Monster Hunter Wilds players.

Publisher/developer Capcom first revealed the next game in the Monster Hunter series in December at The Game Awards 2023. When it releases in 2025, Monster Hunter Wilds will be the 28th title released under the Monster Hunter brand, which dates back to the original game's 2004 release on PlayStation, with the most recent release being 2023's augmented reality mobile game Monster Hunter Now .

The Seikret is a bipedal winged and feathered dinosaur-like beast that will provide its rider with a variety of useful skills, with possibly the most exciting being its ability to carry an extra weapon. The Seikret is equipped with a weapon sling that allows it to carry a secondary weapon, and players will be able to use this feature to switch between two weapons while they are on hunts, which should provide a wider variety of combat options without requiring players to return home to switch weapons. The gameplay trailer for Monster Hunter Wilds revealed during the May PlayStation State of Play showed off this feature, as a character mounts up, switches from a melee weapon to a ranged weapon, and opens fire on an incoming beast.

The Seikret Adds More Options to Monster Hunter Wilds

The Seikret is only one of the many monsters confirmed for Monster Hunter Wilds so far. In addition to its handy weapon sling, the mount will have plenty of other useful skills that players will want to make use of. It possesses a keen sense of smell, which it will utilize to help guide players to pre-set objectives or any other location they manually select on the game's map. Additionally, it will provide a mounted combat option, allowing players to attack with a slinger while riding it, in addition to using some items during travel, including health restoration and weapon sharpening items.

The Seikret isn't the only new feature coming to the game. Some large creatures in Monster Hunter Wilds will move in packs, each with its own set of behaviors, which should add some depth to how the creatures in the game's world interact with each other. Additionally, The Forbidden Lands will provide new locations for players to set their hunts in, with the first revealed being the ecologically diverse Winward Plans, which will combine grasslands, deserts and rock formations.

item.title: Best Bellwright Mods You Should Try
item.description:
Many popular games have mods created by the fanbase to either add new gameplay elements, such as in the active Sims modding community, or mods that can add quality-of-life components. With the growing popularity of the game Bellwright , many fans have started to create their own mods to enhance the game greatly.

Whether fans of the game are looking to increase their renown more easily, allow their tools to last forever, or even prevent their food from spoiling, there are many mods that can be downloaded to supplement gameplay. These are some of the best mods available now through Nexus Mods.

8 Inventory Expansion

Increase Inventory Space For Free

Added bonuses :

  • More inventory space
  • Less need to return to your camp

As they begin their adventure through Bellwright, many players will notice that there isn't much space for items in their inventory. There are not a lot of slots open, making it difficult to continue on harvesting trips and picking up new items that can be found in the overworld. As a result, players might often have to move back and forth between their personal shack at their camp and their harvesting spots.

To remedy this issue, the Inventory Expansion mod can greatly increase the amount of space in the inventory, including in any bag, small backpack, and log sling. Say goodbye to having to worry about overfilling a bag, as it will be able to hold any item players uncover while out harvesting.

7 Infinite Tool Durability

Tools Will Last Forever

Added bonuses :

  • No need to craft multiple tools
  • No need to repeatedly pick up materials to repair a tool

Finding that tools and weapons might not last as long as expected? Whenever players utilize a tool frequently in the game, such as an axe for cutting down trees, or a carpenter's hammer for crafting items, they will eventually get to the point where the tool will become significantly worn down and unusable. Eventually, the item will break.

With the Infinite Tool Durability mod, fans of the popular survival game Bellwright will no longer have to worry about repairing their tools and foraging for the items to fix them. This will save a lot of time and effort, and allow players to enjoy the other, more interesting aspects of the game, such as exploring the sprawling landscapes.

6 Fast Fertilizer

Craft Fertilizer In Less Time

Added bonuses :

  • Less time spent crafting fertilizer
  • More fertilizer can be made

Fertilizer is a necessary item to have in Bellwright , as it allows players to create quality and profitable crops such as wheat. However, crafting fertilizer takes a bit of time, which can take away from the rest of what the game has to offer.

The Fast Fertilizer mod comes in to save the day, as it can speed up the crafting process significantly. This mod has a couple of versions, including 2x, 5x, 10x, 100x, and 1-minute versions, so players can choose the speed at which their fertilizer grows. This gives more variety and options, especially for those who only want a slight bit of help, but still want to play the game mostly in the way it was intended.

5 No Movement Stamina Cost

Stamina Cost Completely Eliminated

Added bonuses :

  • Less chance of being bombarded by enemies
  • Higher chance of survival

If players want to be able to escape enemy attacks and run away, or quickly dodge and jump, they will need to use quite a bit of stamina. In the beginning, the stamina bar will be quite low, meaning that players will quickly deplete their stamina after only a few jumps. This makes players easy targets for wolves or bandits.

The No Movement Stamina Cost mod will completely eliminate the use of stamina whenever a character sprints, jumps, or dodges an attack. Let's face it, it is never a fun experience being completely pummeled by the enemy and not being able to escape. With No Movement Stamina Cost installed, players can quickly make their exit and build up their strength before reapproaching the enemy.

4 Better Villagers - Faster Tasks

Complete Tasks In Less Time

Added bonuses :

  • More time to complete additional tasks
  • Allows villagers to help out more

Many fans might have noticed that sometimes their villagers take quite a while to complete a task. Whether it's through cooking, crafting, harvesting, or whatever they are currently working on, it seems to take them all day to complete what players might need from them.

To remedy this issue, the Better Villagers - Faster Tasks mod will progressively increase the speed at which villagers complete their tasks. This includes cooking, crafting, farming, harvesting, hunting, laboring, and researching, all incredibly important sections in maintaining an encampment. This will allow players to see their camps expand much faster and allow for more villagers to move in.

3 Map Revealer

Unlock All Locations

Added bonuses :

  • No guessing on where to find resources
  • Allows players to find hidden towns or locations

As in many games, players will start out by having an almost empty map. This means they will have to explore each and every area, through every nook and cranny, which can take a ton of time to do. Though this can be an enjoyable experience, it can also make things more difficult in a complicated survival game.

When adding the Map Revealer mod, the entire map will open up to players, removing all the fog and revealing all the locations on the map. This completely eliminates the uncertainty of exploring a new area, which can be detrimental to beginners who are still getting their footing. It will allow them to find safe areas that have resources for them, rather than bandit camps that will take them out in just a few hits.

2 Harvest Multiplier

Increase The Items Received While Harvesting

Added bonuses :

  • More items yielded
  • More opportunities to craft items

Harvesting is one of the first skills players will probably pick up while playing through Bellwright . This is when they will spend time picking up resources like wood, stone, flax, and much more, as well as harvesting plants and food that players create in their encampments.

With the Harvest Multiplier mod, this will take a player's harvesting to the next level. This will offer an increase of either x2 or x5 to how many items will be harvested. This allows players to get more items and resources at once, offering the chance to more quickly build up a camp, which, in turn, increases the number of villagers that can be added.

1 Better Traders - Increased Stock

Purchase More Items Daily

Added bonuses :

  • Increased money made from selling
  • Ability to stock up on more essentials

Whenever players visit a new town, they will often visit the merchants in the area to purchase items they need. This includes booksellers for improving skills, clothing merchants, weapon merchants, and much more. However, some of these merchants are quite limited in what they can offer, and they will have limits on what can be bought and sold in one day.

Adding the Better Traders - Increased Stock mod will give players the ability to sell more items to a merchant, as well as purchase more items from them. There will be increased stock of each item that the merchant has in their inventory as well, so players can stock up on any necessary items to keep their encampment running smoothly. This mod can make such a big difference to the quality of life while playing Bellwright .
